bug.author: irealva
bug.summary: [tfjs-vis] Canvas height changes when plotting loss/accuracy with `show.fitCallbacks`
bug.description:
To get help from the community, we encourage using Stack Overflow and the <denchmark-link:https://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/tensorflow.js>tensorflow.js</denchmark-link> tag. <denchmark-h:h4>TensorFlow.js version</denchmark-h>
@tensorflow/tfjs: 1.1.2 @tensorflow/tfjs-vis: 1.1.0 <denchmark-h:h4>Browser version</denchmark-h>
Chrome Version 76.0.3809.100 (Official Build) (64-bit) <denchmark-h:h4>Describe the problem or feature request</denchmark-h>
When using show.fitCallbacks methods in the tf.js vis library, the rendered canvases change height when you hover over certain labels. <denchmark-h:h4>Code to reproduce the bug / link to feature request</denchmark-h>
Reproduce by following the official tfjs-vis example <denchmark-link:https://storage.googleapis.com/tfjs-vis/mnist/dist/index.html>here</denchmark-link> . Try hovering over the labels in the chart and seeing how the chart height changes. <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8978670/63231647-aec37b00-c1ec-11e9-924c-98f43192c7ee.gif></denchmark-link>

comments.comment: thanks for the reminder <denchmark-link:https://github.com/irealva>@irealva</denchmark-link> ! Will take a look.
